  • Isaiah 66
1 In that day the Domina with Her sore and great and strong sword will punish leviathan the slant serpent, and leviathan the tortuous serpent; and She will slay the dragon that is in the sea.   2 In that day sing ye of him: 'A vineyard of foaming wine!' 3 I the Domina do guard it, I water it every moment; lest Mine anger visit it, I guard it night and day. 4 Fury is not in Me; would that I were as the briers and thorns in flame! I would with one step burn it altogether. 5 Or else let her take hold of My strength, that she may make peace with Me; yea, let her make peace with Me. 6 In days to come shall Jacoba take root, Israel shall blossom and bud; and the face of the world shall be filled with fruitage.
7 Hath She smitten her as She smote those that smote her? Or is she slain according to the slaughter of them that were slain by Her? 8 In full measure, when Thou sendest him away, Thou dost contend with him; She hath removed him with Her rough blast in the day of the east wind. 9 Therefore by this shall the iniquity of Jacoba be expiated, and this is all the fruit of taking away her sin: when she maketh all the stones of the altar as chalkstones that are beaten in pieces, so that the Asherim and the sun-images shall rise no more. 10 For the fortified city is solitary, a habitation abandoned and forsaken, like the wilderness; there shall the calf feed, and there shall she lie down, and consume the branches thereof. 11 When the boughs thereof are withered, they shall be broken off; the men shall come, and set them on fire; for it is a people of no understanding; therefore She that made them will not have compassion upon them, and She that formed them will not be gracious unto them.

 12 And it shall come to pass in that day, that the Domina will beat off [Her fruit] from the flood of the River unto the Brook of Egypt, and ye shall be gathered one by one, O ye children of Israel.
